text:
Good morning everyone,

I have a question regarding the Private app on HubSpot. Who has some extra information for me regarding best practices on how to implement a Private app on HubSpot?

And also implementation of Native integration with a HubSpot private app please?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

Hello,

Given the fact that API keys will be retiring end of November, we'll have to shift all existing codes using API keys to access tokens/Oauth instead.

In our case we use API keys in numerous custom codes within our workflows.
We have a total of 500+ workflows, does that mean we'll have to go through the entire workflow list 1 by 1 to see which workflows have a custom code? Or is there a more efficient way to do so?

Thank you!

Hi all :slightly_smiling_face: Sorry I post this message because we have a legal problem regarding our Website (EU Laws).
Currently a lot of companies receive letters from lawyers because of a privacy law violation.
When visiting our Website, users automatically connect to a google API for our Google Exo2 *Font.* This is not allowed regarding the current data/privacy laws (for the whole EU, so italy is also affected).
To fix this, we need to save our Google Fonts on our local servers. Do you ever have a similar issue like this? How can I fix it? Thanks a lot! :pray:
Hi Stefano, this depends on the theme or template you are using for your website and how it is coded. Did you develop the theme, is it a purchased theme, or did you work with a developer?

no, unfortunately I didn't develop the templates myself. But with the right indications I could do it, in the past I worked a little on Html, css and javascript. Is it difficult to fix this type of problem? could you give me directions? thanks a lot
Unfortunately no, it is not very simple and really depends on how the theme is structured.
do you have a link to the site you can share?

ciao Stefano! Check out this article (scroll down to the "use custom fonts" section – the last section of the page): <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/use-fonts-in-HubSpot>

If you take these steps it might solve your issue:
• download the font files and upload them to your HubSpot file system directly
• then declare the fonts into your theme's style sheets with references to the file system URLs
• apply the fonts with CSS to your site
And remove the loading of Google fonts...
<@U03AKL6Q1B2> hi, im having the same problem. This google fonts includes come with the function standard_header_includes and i cannt find where to remove it

We have a domain connected to HubSpot via reverse proxy. It works, but it seems to only be able to be used for a single content type at a time---website pages or landing pages---but not both at the same time. Does anyone know why? I’m able to do `Connect domain with more content types` but then if I select `Landing pages` and save, it unchecks `Website`, and vice versa.
Hi Cristian, refer to the article above from Nich, it should help answer your question
Does anybody know if there is a storage limit on the File Manager?
Apparently this article was updated today

Bump, still trying to figure this out. :disappointed: HubSpot support really needs a tech division. Almost every time I contact support, they simply post something from the docs, which is either irrelevant, or already mentioned by me.
Secondary domains can be multiple content types, right? i.e. landing pages and website pages. :neutral_face:

Hello everyone!
i am stuck in a problem can you help me
 When I put JavaScript in a module, the page need to refresh again to see the changes of modules fields. I want instant change without page refresh
